conversation.content: Look, I I just need these brackets. Um, they're they're not here.
Oh, um, let me just—actually, hold on—I need to pull up your account first. Can you, uh, give me your order number or the account number for the practice?
It's it's ACC-4982. Dr. Chen's office.

Perfect, so I've got—um, wait, let me just—okay, account ACC-4982-DH, and I'm seeing here that, uh, your last shipment was marked delivered but you're saying the orthodontic brackets weren't included?
Um, yeah, exactly. We we only got half. Half!
That's—I mean, I'm really sorry about that, um, let me check the manifest here for shipment SHP-7263-XK and, uh, oh—actually I think I see—no wait, let me just verify this.
Can you just—I mean, um, the doctor's getting really really upset.
I completely understand, and, um, I wish I had better news but the system's showing that order ORD-9847-TM only had twenty units authorized, not the forty you're expecting.
No no no, that's wrong. We ordered forty. I I placed it myself.
Um, so here's what I can—er, actually, hmm, let me dig deeper because I see there's a modification flag on this order from last Tuesday.
Tuesday? Um, nobody changed anything Tuesday.
Right, so, uh, I'm looking at the audit log here and—um, oh, this is strange—transaction TXN-892764-B shows an inventory adjustment but, er, I can't access the full details from my level.
Your level? So so someone else could fix this?
Well, I mean, technically yes but, um, I'm only able to process replacements up to a certain dollar amount and, uh, these specialty brackets are outside my authorization limit.
I just—look, um, we have patients tomorrow. Kids kids with appointments.

Oh, that's—I really, really wish I could just override this but, um, the system won't let me process anything over the threshold and, er, these are flagged as controlled inventory under code INV-8827-SP.
Can I just, um, is there—could I talk to someone who who can?
Of course, um, I can definitely escalate this to a supervisor but, uh, I should mention the wait might be about fifteen to twenty minutes right now.
Fifteen—okay okay, um, I'll wait. I have to. The kids, they they need these.

Absolutely, and, er, while I'm placing you in the queue for supervisor assistance, um, I'm adding priority flag PRF-7264 to your case so they'll have all the context about the missing brackets and tomorrow's appointments.
